title: Why am i being matched with silver teammates against mid-plat enemies? (i am g1)
body:
Needless to say, i lost that game (after going 5/1 in lane too lmao.)

So how exactly am i expected to win here?

replies.body: IMO if Riot matches people from different divisions together, the person that isn't from their 'proper bracket' should be guaranteed their primary role.

Youre taking things out of context, You literally only had 1 silver teammate. And he currently has a 67% winrate. He was a jungle shaco main who got filled top.

Your team was all mid-high gold with 1 plat 4,  and the enemy team wasnt "mid plat"  the enemy team 2 plat 5, 1 plat 3, 1 plat 4, and a gold 5.

If you want to make a qq thread, dont lie please. It doesnt help your case.

> [{quoted}](name=Snapp2Kill,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=NEZGmExs,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-05-24T00:43:15.947+0000)

>The enemy team wasnt "mid plat". The enemy team had **two plat 5's**, **1 plat 3**, **1 plat 4**, and a gold 5.

4 enemies are platinum, and one of them is plat 3, which is mid-plat.

I had one platinum teammate, 3 golds, and one silver.

3 low plats, 1 mid plat, one gold > > > one low plat, 3 high golds and one silver

It doesnt matter how you try to phrase it, this is still a giant imbalance that WILL affect the game.

i just experienced something similar...

Me: 63% season wide win rate. 
Mid: 14% Season Wide
Top 26% Season Wide

Against a team with all 53% win rate season wide enemies.

WTF is this?
